reviews.review: One of the best first person shooter adventure games I've ever played, get it, it's worth it.
Amazing game. One of the best stories out there.

Malgré le faite qu'il soit beau graphiquement je trouve le jeu assez simple au niveau du gameplay par rapport aux 2 premiers opus ( les plasmides sont presque inutile , on galère moins avec les munitions bref pas de réel challenge ) . Deplus l'hisstoire est totalement retourne cerveau et on peut voir pas mal d'incoérence ( j'évite les spoils ^^ ) 

Bref si vous aimez tiré sur tout ce qui bouge ce jeu est fait pour vous mais si comme moi ( ou d'autre personne ) vous jouer plus a un jeu pour son histoire et la stabilité de celle-ci je vous invite a jouer au deux premiers :) 
(Si vous voulez quand même le prendre prenez le en solde ) ;)
Incredible game it plays great on all platforms I have played this on!

This game is absolutely fantastic. Many people I know don't necessarily enjoy though because of the "simplified gameplay" or something like that (they related it to other shooters instead of a Bioshock game). I on the other hand, loved the gameplay. For me, it felt smooth and fast paced, neatly blending in with cutscenes or any other event in the game. Not to mention that the game's environment is just so breathtaking. It's highly immersive, almost to the point that you forget you're sitting in your bedroom. The characters are deep and not predictable in the slightest. Especially Elizabeth and Booker. Elizabeth is highly helpful in combat and very rarely (like VERY RARELY) fails to save you with some ammunition, a health item, or whatever else she finds. The plot itself may feel straightforward and maybe even cliche to some, but that only counts until you meet Elizabeth. After that, all bets are off. The plot will go in directions that it'd (Bio)shock you left and right. Puns aside, just buy the game. I don't want this review to go on and on and on so, just buy it. You will not regret it.

I have yet to buy the DLCs, but I'm sure they won't disappoint either. JUST BUY THE BLOODY GAME.

The game is awesome, the few hours i played it, but the problems i had with the DirectX crashing put me off after having to restart the level every 30 mins due to the game crashing. Not worth the hassle.
Incredibly overrated and generic fps experience, with a hollow and pretentious story.

ストーリーや世界観も最高峰レベルですので是非お勧めできる作品だと思います。

What a game. On sale now too. I bought this game with huge expectations and it really has excelled. It is very Thematic and you could get lost in it for hours. I have not played any dlc but as far as the story goes. It is really impeccable writing. The whole game enviroment is a masterpiece not just a backdrop. in my first 4 hours I had already taken 58 screenshots. The rewards for exploring are pretty good I do however not like the way that some of the side missions are brought up and how out of the way you go just to complete them but it is optional. Wonderfull game Stunning mechanics and brilliant artwork
Fantastic. Simply fantastic.

Let's start with the following. Pros: The game is graphically amazing and story wise it is extremely good. Cons: I had a few bugs and glitches and the VO was at times so soft I needed subtitles. During the game I got a little bored with how the story dragged out the plots where you need someone/something and their either dead or want something so you have to, over and over, look for another way.

Narratively this is a great game and the normal mixup of Bioshock's powers with shooting made it a very enjoyable experiance. The story however makes the game shine. It's very Star Trek/DC Universe when it comes to the multiverse and I would have loved it to end differently, but (play the game to get this part) that's just the door that the story opened... Just would not have been the door I chose...

I just finished this game. It's hard to describe how good it is, without sounding effusive, so I'm not going to worry about it. Adam Sessler said it was  the "Citizen Kane" of games. I wouldn't go quite that far, but it really does serve to elevate the medium above twitch shooters and RTS's.

The story holds your hand but doesn't make you feel like you're on rails. Elizabeth as a NPC is a perfect match for Booker DeWitt, your character. Play it. You'll love it.

Efter "Gone Home" er dette mit valg for året spil 2013.

+'er:
+ Elizabeth. Jeg elsker bare når man har en følgesvend som hjæper én og ikke er i vejen. Ikke siden "Prince of Persia 2008" har jeg været så glad for en med-karakter. (Det var så også det eneste plus ved "Prince of Persia 2008")
+ Skuespillet er helt i top og troværdige hele vejen igennem.
+ DLC er ikke nødvendigt. Man kan sagtens spille "BioShock Infinite" uden.

-'er:
- Der er ikke meget nyt ved at spille det igennem igen.
- Spillet lider meget af "dominant strategy". Da man hurtigt får sig nogle ynglings vigors/våben, og spiller med dem igennem hele spillet. 
Derfor kan nogle af kampene virke meget halv kedeligt.
- SKAL spilles til ende for at få det fulde udbytte.

Bioshock Infinite is a masterpiece of storytelling in gaming.  It is a prime example of what kind of story can be told and to what effect when utalising of the tools a video game presents to do so.  This is just one of the reasons i have played through it over a dozen times.  

Columbia is a absolutely breathtaking world and you will easily find yourslef getting carried away just wanting too look around and see everything.  From the first moment you see it you just fall in love with it.  Those first steps through the city are such a marvel unlike anything I have ever experienced before in a game.  You want to hear every line of dialog from all of the people on the streets, and just sit there and take in the sights, from musical acts, to the fabulous scenery, everthing this city lays out is fantastic.

Elizabeth and Booker take center stage in this piece of art though.  The chemestry between them is like none other I have ever witnessed.  Booker is a hardened P.I. going into columbia to find and rescue Elizabeth,  while Elizabeth is a girl who has been locked in a tower for the past 19 years guarded by the Songbird, a giant mechanical bird that will do whatever it takes to keep her there.  But being locked up for so long, she has developed a child like nievety towards the world.  And it is this that makes it so  great to see these two interact when they first meet up.  But don't let that make you think Elizabeth is stupid and helpless.  She has spent her time reading and studying about the world,  and she certainly helps Booker along, and progresses in her own way as the story continues.  She also possess the ability to open tears, windows to other worlds.  This gift of hers not only makes for some interesting gameplay, but ties in heavily to the story.

With story telling mechanics like parallel universes, you might think the game is not able to do its self justice and leave a open a lot of loose ends,  But Bioshock Infinite ties it all up really well leaving little unaswered.  It is a very ambitious story that is absolutley jaw dropping when all is said and done.  And it demands to be replayed.  You will find yourself starting again right after the credits finish.  

Its all these things and more that Make Bioshock Infinite an experience like no other and my favourite game of all time.  It really is that good,  if you consider yourself a gamer, you owe it to yourself to play it.  It is a benchmark in videogame story telling,  and no matter what people say, it has great combat!  Vigor are loads of fun and the skylines add big sense of speed  and agility to fights.  Columbia is one of the best worlds ever created second only to Rapture.  

Rapture originally was loved for having great atmosphere and being very creepy, but you always knew the city had more to tell, especially in its early years.  Burial at Sea lets you see what the city was like before the civil war and that is reason enough to buy the seasons pass,  but its great continuation on the story line from Infinite is very cool.  It also has a very different approach to gameplay, relying more on stealth and branching paths, Burial at Sea almost feels like a different game.  

I can not recommend this game enough, and if you have not played it, now is as good a time as ever, its cheap and Burial at Sea Part 2 is almost upon us!  Bioshock Infinite is a Crowining achievement in gaming that deserves your attention.
